item.title: Sonic Racing CrossWorlds Leak Reveals Pac-Man DLC Release Window
item.content:encoded:
A new leak for Sonic Racing CrossWorlds reveals that the Pac-Man DLC is expected to arrive in January 2026.

Sonic Racing CrossWorlds has been out for some time now, bringing good competition to the kart racing space. Recently, we also learned that the game will be facing Mario Kart World next month, with the title receiving a Nintendo Switch 2 release date. Now, the next DLC’s release window for the title has been leaked.

Pac-Man DLC for Sonic Racing CrossWorlds Arrives in January 2026

The release window for Sonic Racing CrossWorlds’ Pac-Man DLC was revealed by a user on X (formerly Twitter). Their recent post includes an in-game screenshot with “Crossover Course, Release expected in January” written on it. The course is locked and Pac-Man-themed, with Pac-Man himself driving a kart alongside Sonic. When asked how they came across this find, the user revealed that they updated the game before the Pac-Man festival, and the devs let them in “an hour early”.

Sonic Racing CrossWorlds is really living up to its name, crossing over with as many franchises as possible. The game has already collaborated with the likes of Persona, Like a Dragon, Minecraft, and more. The latest collaboration is with SpongeBob SquarePants, which, along with new racers, machines, courses, and more, also brought the SpongeBob SquarePants festival, which introduced additional rewards players can acquire.

In other news, Sonic Racing CrossWorlds’ producer has stated that Mario Kart World won’t influence it. Additionally, Sonic the Hedgehog might be renamed to ‘Sonic CD’. What are your thoughts on Sonic Racing CrossWorlds Pac-Man DLC’s release window leaking online? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Resident Evil Requiem devs revealing how Grace differs from previous protagonists. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Hypershot Codes (November 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Hypershot codes for November 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Gems, Coins, and much more.

Hypershot is a high-tempo shooting experience where versatile abilities and various weapons play a major role. Your objective is to become an expert marksman and dominate all game modes without breaking a sweat. To achieve this massive feat, you’ll need extra help from the featured active Hypershot codes. Stack up on free Gems and Coins within a few seconds and instantly unlock the finest weapons and abilities without the tiring grind. By redeeming these Roblox promo codes, all the players will get to reach Hypershot’s gameplay zenith and climb the leaderboard swiftly. 

Active Hypershot Codes

  • THANKSGIVING – 3,000 Gems and 30,000 Coins (New)

Inactive Hypershot Codes

There are no expired codes for Hypershot. If any of the active codes go invalid, they will be added in this section. You can expect the existing active codes to turn inactive during big updates and notable milestones. 

How To Redeem Hypershot Codes

Use these instructions to redeem the active codes in Hypershot:

  1. Launch Hypershot and stay on the game’s main menu. 
  2. Press the “Rewards” button located on the top middle part of the screen. 
  3. Scroll down to the last to spot the code box.
  4. Copy and paste the code into the “ENTER CODE HERE” text box.  
  5. Click the “REDEEM” button to activate the code. 

More About Hypershot Codes

The free Gems can be spent on the abilities featured below: 

These Cases can be purchased using the Coins: 

  • Wooden Case – 5000 Coins
  • Bronze Case – 10,000 Coins
  • Silver Case – 20,000 Coins
  • Gold Case – 30,000 Coins
  • Diamond Case – 40,000 Coins

FAQs on Hypershot codes

What are the latest codes in Hypershot?

THANKSGIVING is the only latest code in Hypershot.

What codes can be redeemed for the maximum amount of Coins in Hypershot?

THANKSGIVING can be redeemed for a staggering 30,000 Coins.  

When will the active codes expire in Hypershot?

The active codes are speculated to expire during major in-game updates.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Devs Reveal How Grace Differs from Previous Protagonists
item.content:encoded:
Resident Evil Requiem features a brand-new protagonist, Grace Ashcroft, and the devs recently spoke about how she differs from other protagonists.

Capcom seems to be cooking up a storm with Resident Evil Requiem, and the anticipation is only going higher as the release date draws closer. Recently, the developers revealed during an interview that the upcoming title will feature characters from previous games. Now, the producer has opened up about how Requiem’s Grace is different from other main characters.

Resident Evil Requiem’s Grace is An Ordinary Person, But is a ‘Bit More Used to Guns’

During a new interview with CheckpointGaming, Resident Evil Requiem’s producer Masato Kumazawa was asked to talk about Grace. Kumazawa explained that the whole point is “scaring the players,” and, from his perspective, “she is the most scared or easily prone to being scared protagonist in the series.” The producer added that he wants other players to “be scared with her and enjoy the atmosphere with her,” noting that “she’s an ordinary person.”

However, Requiem’s Grace is an FBI Analyst, which makes her well-versed with guns. At the same time, when comparing characters like Chris and Leon, “they’re not like, ‘Oh, we get a gun, and we start shooting everything,’ or we get to close combat and have no problem.” When talking about ordinary, Kumazawa believes that Ethan is “the most ordinary in terms of just saying normal”; Grace is just a bit more used to guns than he is.

Kumazawa added that Grace is not an expert like Leon or Chris. They aim to make players feel they have limited resources and to have them figure out “what they can do with the limited amount of things that they have.” The game is closer to “classic type of horror survival,” but it’s not all classic as there are “new elements and new weapons in order to make it more fun.”

In other news, a new claim states Resident Evil Requiem definitely has at least one DLC in development. Additionally, the upcoming title is expected to sell better than RE Village. What are your thoughts on Resident Evil Requiem’s Grace Ashcroft? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Hytale revealing its early access release date next week. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
